title: Ford Hires Apple's Doug Field to Advance Technology Role; The executive played a key role in developing Tesla's Model 3 compact car and has been working on the iPhone maker's car project
text:
"This is a watershed moment for our company," Mr. Farley said.

After departing Tesla in 2018, Mr. Field returned to Apple, where he has been working on the iPhone maker's secret car project. His departure will be another disruption for an effort that has seen several leadership changes.

"We're grateful for the contributions Doug has made to Apple and we wish him all the best in this next chapter," Apple said in a statement.

Mr. Field began his engineering career at Ford in 1987 before detouring into a career that took to the avante garde of personal transportation. He was a key executive at Segway, which developed a self-balancing electric scooter, before being recruited to Apple under the late Steve Jobs. At Apple, he oversaw the development of Macs before Elon Musk recruited him to Tesla in 2013 to work on product development.

At Tesla, he played a key role in the development of the Model 3 and its sister vehicle, the Model Y compact sport-utility vehicle. Amid the production struggles of the Model 3, he left and joined Apple's car project.

Write to Tim Higgins at Tim.Higgins@WSJ.com
